item.title: Categorizing Probability Distributions
item.description: There are two fundamental tasks one might use statistics for: 1. Predicting outcomes. You have a model of a how a process works and want to know what sort of data it will generate. 2. Understanding outcomes. You have data and want to know what sort of model generated it. We can use these tasks to guide our organization of common probability distributions. 1. Predicting Outcomes (model known, data unknown) Let’s start with the first task: model is known; data is not.
